Constants

XMPP4R_VERSION = '0.5'   XMPP4R Version number. This is the ONLY place where the version number should be specified. This constant is used to determine the version of package tarballs and generated gems.

Public Class methods

debug()

returns true if debugging mode is enabled. If you just want to log something if debugging is enabled, use Jabber::debuglog instead.

[Source]

    # File lib/xmpp4r/debuglog.rb, line 45
45:   def Jabber::debug
46:     @@debug
47:   end
debug=(debug)

Enable/disable debugging mode. When debug mode is enabled, information can be logged using Jabber::debuglog. When debug mode is disabled, calls to Jabber::debuglog are just ignored.

[Source]

    # File lib/xmpp4r/debuglog.rb, line 26
26:   def Jabber::debug=(debug)
27:     @@debug = debug
28:     if @@debug
29:       debuglog('Debugging mode enabled.')
30:       #if debug is enabled, we should automatically enable warnings too
31:       Jabber::warnings = true
32:     end
33:   end
debuglog(string)

Outputs a string only if debugging mode is enabled. If the string includes several lines, 4 spaces are added at the beginning of each line but the first one. Time is prepended to the string.

[Source]

    # File lib/xmpp4r/debuglog.rb, line 52
52:   def Jabber::debuglog(string)
53:     return if not @@debug
54:     logger.debug string.chomp.gsub("\n", "\n    ")
55:   end
logger()

[Source]

    # File lib/xmpp4r/debuglog.rb, line 8
 8:   def Jabber::logger
 9:     @@logger ||= Logger.new($stderr)
10:   end
logger=(logger)

Set the logger to use for debug and warn (if enabled)

[Source]

    # File lib/xmpp4r/debuglog.rb, line 13
13:   def Jabber::logger=(logger)
14:     @@logger = logger
15:   end
warnings=(warnings)

Enable/disable warnings mode.

[Source]

    # File lib/xmpp4r/debuglog.rb, line 36
36:   def Jabber::warnings=(warnings)
37:     @@warnings = warnings
38:     if @@warnings
39:       warnlog('Warnings mode enabled.')
40:     end
41:   end
warnlog(string)

Outputs a string only if warnings mode is enabled.

[Source]

    # File lib/xmpp4r/debuglog.rb, line 58
58:   def Jabber::warnlog(string)
59:     return if not @@warnings
60:     logger.warn string.chomp.gsub("\n", "\n    ")
61:   end
